alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 23 at 1:32PM PST until January 26 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MONDAY TO 8 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet with local sets to 12 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Central Coast and Santa Barbara County Central Coast. * WHEN...From 6 AM Monday to 8 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast
